o.description:
he, she, it.

— Middle o
— Old ol
— Proto *ol “demonstrative adjective and third person singular pronoun”

ağrı.description:
pain, ache.

— Ottoman آغری — Middle ağrı
— Old ağrığ
— Proto *ağrığ
— Proto *ağrı- *+(U)ğ
— Proto ağrı- — Proto *ağrı- It is common for the U vowel that gets stuck in between to disappear.
— Proto *ağıəı- — Proto *ağıəı +I- — Proto *ağıəı “mouth; feeding and vocal organ” — Proto *ağ- *+(U)ə — Proto *ağ-

uymak.description: (intransitive) to follow, to go with. — Middle uy- Standard /ḏ/ → /y/ transformation. — Old uğ- — Proto *uğ- “to follow”

+(U)z.description: As observed in the word “ikiz”, it derives plural nouns by attaching to the noun. It is extremely rare. Perhaps, among the words it derives too are “biz” and “siz”. II. A suffix left over from primitive times that functions to produce nouns from verbs. It has lost its functionality today.

iz.description: footmark, scar. — Old iz Standard /ə/ → /z/ transformation. — Proto *iə “footprint” — Proto *i- *+(U)ə — Proto *i- Standard /ğ/ → /∅/ transformation. — Proto *iğ- “to walk”
